description: a(1) = 0, a(2) = -2; for n > 2, a(n) + a(n-2) - a(n-3) - a(n-5) - ... - a(n-p) = (-1)^(n+1)*n if n is prime, otherwise = 0, where p = largest prime < n.
comments: Arises in studying the Goldbach conjecture.
references: P. A. MacMahon, Properties of prime numbers deduced from the calculus of symmetric functions, Proc. London Math. Soc., 23 (1923), 290-316. [Coll. Papers, Vol. II, pp. 354-382] [The sequence e_n]
N. J. A. Sloane, A Handbook of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1973 (includes this sequence).
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).

maple: M:=90; e:=array(0..M); e[1]:=0; e[2]:=-2; for n from 3 to M do t1:=-e[n-2]; if isprime(n) then t1:=t1+(-1)^(n+1)*n; fi; for k from 2 to n do p := ithprime(k); if p < n then t1 := t1 + e[n-p]; fi; od: e[n]:=t1; od: [seq(e[n],n=1..M)];
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
